qas.question: John XXIII was an advocate for what?
What did he write about human rights in?
His advocacy from human rights included whom?
What work, written by widows, focused on human rights?

plausible_answers.text: food, clothing, shelter, medical care, rest, and, finally, the necessary social services

qas.question: What do people who are disabled need the most, according to widows?
What are two groups that need the most services, according to widows?

plausible_answers.text: in the event of ill health

qas.question: What is one time that widows think the unborn should be taken care of?

context: John XXIII was an advocate for <a0_0><b3_0>human rights<b3_0/><a0_0/> which included <a2_0><b6_0>the unborn and the elderly<b6_0/><a2_0/>. He wrote about human rights in <a1_0>his <b4_0>Pacem in terris<b4_0/><a1_0/>. He wrote, "Man has the right to live. He has the right to bodily integrity and to the means necessary for the proper development of life, particularly <b5_0>food, clothing, shelter, medical care, rest, and, finally, the necessary social services<b5_0/>. In consequence, he has the right to be looked after <b7_0>in the event of ill health<b7_0/>; disability stemming from his work; widowhood; old age; enforced unemployment; or whenever through no fault of his own he is deprived of the means of livelihood."
